citations.narrative:
The licensee has not yet finished a contingency plan for the kennel. The facility must develop, document and follow a plan
to provide humane handling, care transportation and treatment during an emergency or disaster. This plan is essential to
be prepared for emergencies to ensure humane care of the animals at the kennel during unexpected events. Finish the
contingency plan for the kennel.
Correct by: 8/14/2024

Monthly preventive health checks completed by the licensee are not being documented. The yearly physical exam
findings for all the dogs completed in April 2024 have not been recorded in each dogs’ medical records. Medical records
must include the results of these examinations. This information is essential for APHIS inspectors, the licensee and the
attending veterinarian to evaluate the health of the dogs is the kennel. Ensure that medical records are complete and kept
up to date. Record medical examination findings from the last veterinary physical exam findings for the dogs.
Correct by: 8/14/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee has not yet finished a contingency plan for the kennel. The facility must develop, document and follow a plan 
to provide humane handling, care transportation and treatment during an emergency or disaster. This plan is essential to 
be prepared for emergencies to ensure humane care of the animals at the kennel during unexpected events. Finish the 
contingency plan for the kennel. 
Correct by: 8/14/2024 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Monthly preventive health checks completed by the licensee are not being documented. The yearly physical exam 
findings for all the dogs completed in April 2024 have not been recorded in each dogs’ medical records. Medical records 
must include the results of these examinations. This information is essential for APHIS inspectors, the licensee and the 
attending veterinarian to evaluate the health of the dogs is the kennel. Ensure that medical records are complete and kept 
up to date. Record medical examination findings from the last veterinary physical exam findings for the dogs. 
Correct by: 8/14/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
